content.description: Start with small but decent crimps for hands and a block platform for feet. Traverse left on more decent crimps with small edges for feet until you reach a juggy crack that traverses the middle portion. Once at the left edge of the crack, reach around a corner block with the left hand (this is the crux). With your feet on small edges bring your hips into the wall and then reach around with the right hand and use that core strength to stay on. Then just two more moves to the final decent hold. There is some holds that could be used to top out but its just not that fun to try.
content.location: This boulder is on the level above the first boulders that you see when you walk into the area. You should notice the extreme overhanging cave - just walk around that up a steep scramble and you'll find this one.

content.description: The physical crux is at the bottom getting over the lip. Find slab feet among the moss and climb the crack.
content.location: West face of the Entry Boulder. Stand start under the low roof and climb the crack.

content.description: Shares start with Florida man. Climb directly up through thin crimps in the seam. High feet, slap some slopers, and donâ€™t fall into the tree behind you.
Jump start is not exactly necessary but is very fun. Matched crimp start for the jump could be too small for those with large fingers
content.protection: A couple pads. A good spot is required to make sure the climber does not fall back into a large pine tree
content.location: Located next to Hump Day on the Entry Boulder. Start either matched on the low crimp and jump to the ledge or stand-start on the ledge and climb straight up

content.description: Solid line that leaves you hugging the boulder to top out. Good crimps the whole way up
content.protection: One pad. The landing is flat and soft
content.location: Leftmost problem on the Entry Boulder. Start matched on low crimps then work up and to the left to top out. Walkdown behind the boulder

content.description: First developed boulder upon entering through the trail. Sees good sun and has safe landings save for one tree that sits too close to one problem.
